statement.p: Explain why the vector \left[\begin{array}{c} 9 \\ 4 \\ 4 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] is or is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} 0 \\ -1 \\ 0 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 4 \\ 0 \\ -4 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 1 \\ -3 \\ 2 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 5 \\ 8 \\ -14 \\ -7 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} 7 \\ 6 \\ -10 \\ -7 \end{array}\right].

answer.p: \left[\begin{array}{c} 9 \\ 4 \\ 4 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} 0 \\ -1 \\ 0 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 4 \\ 0 \\ -4 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 1 \\ -3 \\ 2 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 5 \\ 8 \\ -14 \\ -7 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} 7 \\ 6 \\ -10 \\ -7 \end{array}\right].
